trans-unit.source: Authenticates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> security token using a custom authentication scheme.

Override the CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator class when the Windows authentication provided by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class isn't sufficient.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class authenticates the user name and password in a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security token as a Windows account.

To provide a custom authentication scheme, derive a class from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator> class, implement the authentication scheme, and then pass that class to the constructor for the CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> class using the specified validator.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator> specified in the `validator` parameter is used by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateUserNamePasswordCore%2A> method to authenticate the user.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator"></xref> that authenticates the user name and password using a custom authentication scheme.
Authenticates the specified user name and password and returns the set of authorization policies for <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens.

The ValidateUserNamePasswordCore method uses the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator> passed into the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to authenticate the user.
When the username and password cannot be validated, throw the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenValidationException>.

When there are no authorization policies in effect for this application, return an empty <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy>.

When `null` is returned from the ValidateUserNamePasswordCore method, [!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/add/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] throws the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenValidationException>.
The user name associated with the security token.
The password associated with the security token.

A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref> that contains the set of authorization policies in effect for this application.
